derivation: probably strengthened from a collateral form of the base of G5134 (τρώγω) and G5147 (τρώγω) through the idea of corrosion or wear;
strongs_def: or perhaps rather of a base of G5167 (τρώγω) and G5149 (τρώγω) through the idea of a craunching sound; to gnaw or chew, i.e. (generally) to eat
outline:
1. to gnaw, crunch, chew raw vegetables or fruits (as nuts, almonds)
    1. of animals feeding
    2. of men
  2. to eat
